result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Matthew Ryan Hastings.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt states that there is a joint recommendation for 22CF32; count 1 for 3 years probation and 22CF53; count 1 for a 6 month jail sentence. Count 2 and 3 will be DRI. Court colloquy. MH enters a guilty plea on 22CF53. 

22CF32 - MH doesn't object to revoking the diversion agreement. Court will revoke the DPA. Attorney Forehand asks for probation in this case.

Attorney Bartelt comments about the joint agreement on both cases. 

22CF32; Count 1: 
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Submit to AODA and follow all recommendations for treatment.

Costs waived.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today

22CF53; Court orders:
6 months in the Richland County Jail with huber; to begin on 09/07/22.
Defendant may serve the 6 month in the Juneau County Jail; if they accept him.
Credit of 22 days credit.
Pay costs.

Count 2 and 3- DRI

11:47 AM Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings in court, in custody. Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Matthew Ryan Hastings. DA Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. B states offer was just received from Atty. Forehand; additional status requested (potential plea/sentencing); Def is in custody on a sanction, due for release 9/29.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:04 AM Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody following warrant in this matter.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video for Matthew Ryan Hastings.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Forehand notes Def also has child support warrant. Due to his appearance now in this 22CF53 matter, Court orders 22CF53 warrant vacated. Atty. Forehand asks for $5000 cash bond in 22CF53; states the rationale for this request. Atty. Bartelt - Defense asks for a signature bond or at least a nominal cash bond; notes that Def may not be able to get out of custody due to other matters. Court believes some cash is necessary and sets bail at $5000 cash; after sanction expires and child support matter is dealt with, this bond can always be amended; at this point, cash bond is "academic." Status conference set for 8/31 at 11.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return on warrant on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Bartelt states that his client can't make it to court today. Judge orders a warrant. Court puts the bond in default and will be scheduling a bond forfeiting hearing when picked up.
